00013 void KaGetOpt::Option::parseOptionString(const string& os)
00014 {
00015     string curOpt = "";
00016     for (size_t i = 0; i < os.size() + 1; i++) {
00017         if (i == os.size() || os[i] == ' ') {
00018             if (curOpt != "") options.push_back(curOpt);
00019             curOpt = "";
00020         }
00021         else curOpt += string(1, os[i]);
00022     }
00023 }
00024 
00025 KaGetOpt::Option::Option(const string& options, const string& description, char type) :
00026     description(description), type(type), hasDefaultValue(false), hasValue(false), boundVar(0)
00027 {
00028     parseOptionString(options);
00029 }
00030 
00031 void KaGetOpt::Option::setValue(const string& value)
00032 {
00033     this->hasValue = true;
00034     this->value = value;
00035     if (boundVar) {
00036         if (this->type == 's') *(string*)boundVar = value;
00037         else if (this->type == 'i') *(int*)boundVar = atoi(value.c_str());
00038         else if (this->type == 'd') *(double*)boundVar = atof(value.c_str());
00039         else if (this->type == 'b') *(bool*)boundVar = (value == "true" || value == "1");
00040     }
00041 }

00043 KaGetOpt::Option::Option(const string& options, const string& description, char type, const string& defaultValue) :
00044     description(description), type(type), hasDefaultValue(true), defaultValue(defaultValue), hasValue(false), boundVar(0)
00045 {
00046     parseOptionString(options);
00047 }

00089 string KaGetOpt::getHelp()
00090 {
00091     string ret = "Options: \n";
00092     for (size_t i = 0; i < options.size(); i++) {
00093         ret += "  ";
00094         size_t optsize = 0;
00095         for (size_t j = 0; j < options[i].options.size(); j++) {
00096             string n = (j > 0 ? " , " : "") + options[i].options[j];
00097             ret += n;
00098             optsize += n.size();
00099         }
00100         ret += string((optsize >= 25 ? 1 : 25 - optsize), ' ');
00101         ret += options[i].description;
00102         if (options[i].type == 'b' || options[i].hasDefaultValue) {
00103             ret += " (";
00104             if (options[i].hasDefaultValue) ret += "default: " + options[i].defaultValue;
00105             ret += ")";
00106         }
00107         ret += "\n";
00108     }
00109     return ret;
00110 }

00112 bool KaGetOpt::getIt(const string& option, string& value)
00113 {
00114     for (size_t i = 0; i < options.size(); i++) {
00115         for (size_t j = 0; j < options[i].options.size(); j++) {
00116             if (option == options[i].options[j]) {
00117                 Option& opt = options[i];
00118                 if (!opt.hasValue && !opt.hasDefaultValue) {
00119                     lastError = "No value for " + option;
00120                     return false;
00121                 }
00122                 else {
00123                     value = opt.hasValue ? opt.value : opt.defaultValue;
00124                     return true;
00125                 }
00126             }
00127         }
00128     }
00129     lastError = "Unknown option " + option;
00130     return false;
00131 }
00132 
00133 KaGetOpt::Option* KaGetOpt::findOption(const string& option)
00134 {
00135     for (size_t i = 0; i < options.size(); i++) {
00136         for (size_t j = 0; j < options[i].options.size(); j++) {
00137             if (option == options[i].options[j]) {
00138                 return &(options[i]);
00139             }
00140         }
00141     }
00142     return 0;
00143 }
00144 
00145 bool KaGetOpt::bind(const string& option, string& s)
00146 {
00147     Option* opt = findOption(option);
00148     if (!opt) { lastError = "Unknown option " + option; return false; }
00149     if (opt->type != 's') { lastError = "Option " + option + " is not a string option"; return false; }
00150     opt->boundVar = &s;
00151     if (opt->hasDefaultValue) s = opt->defaultValue;
00152     return true;
00153 }
00154 
00155 bool KaGetOpt::bind(const string& option, int& i)
00156 {
00157     Option* opt = findOption(option);
00158     if (!opt) { lastError = "Unknown option " + option; return false; }
00159     if (opt->type != 'i') { lastError = "Option " + option + " is not an int option"; return false; }
00160     opt->boundVar = &i;
00161     if (opt->hasDefaultValue) i = atoi(opt->defaultValue.c_str());
00162     return true;
00163 }
00164 
00165 bool KaGetOpt::bind(const string& option, double& d)
00166 {
00167     Option* opt = findOption(option);
00168     if (!opt) { lastError = "Unknown option " + option; return false; }
00169     if (opt->type != 'd') { lastError = "Option " + option + " is not a double option"; return false; }
00170     opt->boundVar = &d;
00171     if (opt->hasDefaultValue) d = atof(opt->defaultValue.c_str());
00172     return true;

00174 
00175 bool KaGetOpt::bind(const string& option, bool& b)
00176 {
00177     Option* opt = findOption(option);
00178     if (!opt) { lastError = "Unknown option " + option; return false; }
00179     if (opt->type != 'b') { lastError = "Option " + option + " is not a bool option"; return false; }
00180     opt->boundVar = &b;
00181     if (opt->hasDefaultValue) b = (opt->defaultValue == "true" || opt->defaultValue == "1");
00182     return true;
00183 }

00185 bool KaGetOpt::parseArgs(int argc, char** argv)
00186 {
00187     Option* pendingOption = 0;
00188     string strippedArgs = "";   
00189     for (int i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00190         if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
00191             if (pendingOption && (pendingOption->type == 'i' || pendingOption->type == 'd')) {
00192                 pendingOption->setValue(string(argv[i]));
00193                 pendingOption = 0;
00194             }
00195             else {
00196                 if (pendingOption) {
00197                     if (pendingOption->type == 'b') {
00198                         pendingOption->setValue("true");
00199                         pendingOption = 0;
00200                     }
00201                     else {
00202                         lastError = "No value given for option " + string(argv[i]);
00203                         return false;
00204                     }
00205                 }
00206                 if (string(argv[i]) == "--") {  // stop parsing arguments
00207                     for (int j = i + 1; j < argc; j++) strippedArgs += string(argv[j]) + " ";
00208                     break;
00209                 }
00210                 else {
00211                     pendingOption = findOption(string(argv[i]));
00212                     if (!pendingOption) {
00213                         lastError = "Unknown option " + string(argv[i]);
00214                         return false;
00215                     }
00216                 }
00217             }
00218         }
00219         else {
00220             if (pendingOption) {
00221                 pendingOption->setValue(string(argv[i]));
00222                 pendingOption = 0;
00223             }
00224             else {
00225                 strippedArgs += string(argv[i]) + " ";
00226             }
00227         }
00228     }
00229     if (pendingOption) {
00230         if (pendingOption->type == 'b') pendingOption->setValue("true");
00231         else {
00232             lastError = "No value given for option " + pendingOption->options[0];
00233             return false;
00234         }
00235     }
00236     return true;
00237 }

00239 bool KaGetOpt::getString(const string& option, string& value)
00240 {
00241     return getIt(option, value);
00242 }
00243 
00244 bool KaGetOpt::getInt(const string& option, int& value)
00245 {
00246     string v;
00247     if (!getIt(option, v)) return false;
00248     value = atoi(v.c_str());
00249     return true;
00250 }
00251 
00252 bool KaGetOpt::getDouble(const string& option, double& value)
00253 {
00254     string v;
00255     if (!getIt(option, v)) return false;
00256     value = atof(v.c_str());
00257     return true;
00258 }
00259 
00260 bool KaGetOpt::getBool(const string& option, bool& value)
00261 {
00262     string v;
00263     if (!getIt(option, v)) return false;
00264     value = (v == "true");
00265     return true;
00266 }
